availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: The first Bank of Tennessee was chartered on November 20, 1811, and closed when its charter ended in 1841. The second Bank of Tennessee coexisted with the first, from 1820 to 1832. The third Bank of Tennessee was established in 1838, with branches in Athens, Clarksville, Columbia, Memphis, Rogersville, Shelbyville, Somersville, Sparta, and Trenton. Relocated to Chattanooga in February 1862 due to the Civil War. Records later moved to Georgia and South Carolina, until confiscated by the U.S. Army in 1865. Granville C. Torbett was Bank President form 1861 to the end of the Civil War.

ab.bibl:
"Tennessee Bank Records, 1838-1945," Tennessee State Library and Archives, processed by James A. Hoobler (accessed online December 30, 2019).
KYR-0004-033-0022.
